intro: Catadysia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Catadysia is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils, thriving in moist environments. It plays a role in both ecological systems and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
